name: The Painted Burro

name: Grendel’s Den
happyHour: Entire food menu is half‑priced daily from 5 p.m. to 7:30 p.m. with a $4 beverage minimumhttps://boston.eater.com/maps/best-happy-hours-boston#:~:text=Grendel%E2%80%99s%20Den%20Restaurant%20%26%20Bar.

name: A&B Kitchen & Bar
happyHour: Half‑priced appetizers Monday–Thursday from 2 p.m. to 4:30 p.m. and a $5 burger‑and‑fries deal after 8 p.m.https://boston.eater.com/maps/best-happy-hours-boston#:~:text=A%26B%20Kitchen%20and%20Bar.

name: La Famiglia Giorgio’s
happyHour: Three‑course special (soup or salad, pasta and cannoli) for $30 Monday–Thursday from 3 p.m. to 6 p.m.https://boston.eater.com/maps/best-happy-hours-boston#:~:text=Link.

name: Bred Gourmet (Cambridge)
happyHour: ‘Social Hour’ Monday–Friday from 3 p.m. to 6 p.m. offering $4 chicken tenders, burgers, sliders, fries and beignetshttps://www.thebostoncalendar.com/events/the-19-best-happy-hour-food-drink-deals-around-boston-that-are-actually-worth-it#:~:text=19.

name: Barcelona Wine Bar (Brookline)
happyHour: Happy hour Monday–Friday from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m. with mini cocktails for $7 and snacks priced under $10https://boston.eater.com/maps/best-happy-hours-boston#:~:text=Cambridge

name: Banyan Bar & Refuge
happyHour: Happy hour daily from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m. (extended 2–6 p.m. on Sundays) offering 10 dumplings for $5 and five spring rolls for $5https://www.banyanboston.com/#:~:text=GALLERY.

name: Fat Baby
happyHour: Bottomless maki (sushi rolls) every Monday from 4 p.m. to close for $32https://boston.eater.com/maps/best-happy-hours-boston#:~:text=Fat%20Baby.

name: Petula’s
happyHour: $10 martini night on Mondays from 5 p.m. to closehttps://boston.eater.com/maps/best-happy-hours-boston#:~:text=Petula%E2%80%99s.

name: Local 149
happyHour: Monday–Friday from 4 p.m. to 7 p.m. featuring throwback pricing: $3 tacos (Tuesdays), $10 flatbreads (Thursdays) plus $4 Bud Lights, $10 margaritas, $4 shots and $1 wingshttps://boston.eater.com/maps/best-happy-hours-boston#:~:text=Local%20149.

name: Tuscan Kitchen Seaport
happyHour: ‘Bubbles & Truffles’ special featuring a glass of prosecco and truffle fries for $15 (available at the Seaport location)https://www.thebostoncalendar.com/events/the-19-best-happy-hour-food-drink-deals-around-boston-that-are-actually-worth-it#:~:text=3

name: Loco Taqueria & Oyster Bar (South Boston)

name: Capo Restaurant & Supper Club
happyHour: Bottomless pasta Wednesdays: unlimited pasta for $32 every Wednesdayhttps://www.thebostoncalendar.com/events/the-19-best-happy-hour-food-drink-deals-around-boston-that-are-actually-worth-it#:~:text=5

name: Batifol
happyHour: Unlimited steak frites on Sundays from 4 p.m. to 10 p.m. for $37 per personhttps://www.thebostoncalendar.com/events/the-19-best-happy-hour-food-drink-deals-around-boston-that-are-actually-worth-it#:~:text=7

name: Tasca
happyHour: $5 tapas Monday–Wednesday from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m.https://www.thebostoncalendar.com/events/the-19-best-happy-hour-food-drink-deals-around-boston-that-are-actually-worth-it#:~:text=8.

name: Rebel’s Guild
address: Revere Hotel Boston Common, 200 Stuart St, Boston, MA 02116
happyHour: Mini martini night on Mondays from 5 p.m. to 9:30 p.m. with $7 espresso and dirty martinishttps://www.thebostoncalendar.com/events/the-19-best-happy-hour-food-drink-deals-around-boston-that-are-actually-worth-it#:~:text=9.

name: Shy Bird (South Boston)
happyHour: ‘Shy Hour’ Monday–Friday from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m. with 50‑cent fried chicken dunks, $9.99 smash burgers, $9 cocktails and $6 tall‑boy beershttps://www.thebostoncalendar.com/events/the-19-best-happy-hour-food-drink-deals-around-boston-that-are-actually-worth-it#:~:text=10,Bird%20South%20Boston.

name: Parish Cafe
happyHour: Half‑off sandwiches after 10 p.m. with purchase of a beverage; available Sunday–Wednesday 11:30 a.m.–12 a.m. and Thursday–Saturday 11:30 a.m.–2 a.m.https://www.thebostoncalendar.com/events/the-19-best-happy-hour-food-drink-deals-around-boston-that-are-actually-worth-it#:~:text=12%29%20Half

name: The Broadway (South Boston)
happyHour: Half‑off all pizzas every Tuesday (open 11:30 a.m. – 1:00 a.m.)https://www.thebostoncalendar.com/events/the-19-best-happy-hour-food-drink-deals-around-boston-that-are-actually-worth-it#:~:text=14%29%20Half

name: Yard House Fenway
happyHour: Happy hour Monday–Friday from 3 p.m. to 6 p.m.; half off select appetizers and pizzas and $2 off beer, wine, spirits and cocktailsfile:///home/oai/redirect.html#:~:text=Monday%20,6%3A00PM.

name: Citrus & Salt
happyHour: Weekday ‘Adult Happy Meal’ Monday–Friday from 12 p.m. to 3 p.m., including a margarita, your choice of taco or quesadilla and a side for $18https://www.thebostoncalendar.com/events/the-19-best-happy-hour-food-drink-deals-around-boston-that-are-actually-worth-it#:~:text=20,Meal.

name: Petit Robert Bistro
happyHour: French‑inspired happy hour Monday–Thursday from 3 p.m. to 5:30 p.m.; features $11 spritzes, $8–$11 wine glasses, $6 beers, $1 oysters and $10 escargot plateshttps://www.thebostoncalendar.com/events/the-19-best-happy-hour-food-drink-deals-around-boston-that-are-actually-worth-it#:~:text=21,Robert%20Bistro.

name: Café Saint‑Germain
happyHour: Unlimited French tapas every Monday and Tuesday from 4 p.m. to 10 p.m. for $42 per personhttps://www.thebostoncalendar.com/events/the-19-best-happy-hour-food-drink-deals-around-boston-that-are-actually-worth-it#:~:text=22

name: City Line Bar & Grill
column6: Happy Hour Mon–Fri 3‑6 PM at the bar: $2 off beers, $6 wines, $7 premium well drinks, $10 cosmos & martinis and select appetizers like the Meatball & Ricotta Dip; deals apply for bar seating onlyhttps://www.citylinebar.com/specials#:~:text=Happy%20Hour%27s%20Here%20%E2%80%93%20Because,Why%20Wait%20for%20the%20Weekend

name: Ruth’s Chris Steak House
column6: “Sizzle, Swizzle, Swirl®” happy hour Mon–Fri 4 PM – 6 PM with handcrafted cocktails (e.g., Rocks Rita, Pomegranate Martini, Ruth’s Manhattan), discounted wines & beers plus shareable plates like prime burgers, seared ahi tuna, steak sandwich, spicy shrimp & goat‑cheese artichoke diphttps://m.ruthschris.com/happy-hour/ny/albany-restaurant/7379#:~:text=Happy%20Hour

name: Texas de Brazil
address: Crossgates Mall, 1 Crossgates Mall Rd Space E111, Albany, NY 12203
column6: Happy Hour Mon–Fri 4:30 PM – 6 PM with $4 domestic beers, $6 Caipirinhas & house cocktails, $7 glasses of private‑label wine and $8 house martinishttps://texasdebrazil.com/locations/albany/#:~:text=HAPPY%20HOUR

name: Lost & Found Bar & Kitchen
column6: Daily happy hour specials: Mon–Fri 4 PM–7 PM and Sun 11 AM–6 PM with $1 off drafts & well drinks; additional rotating deals include Wednesday hot‑dog specials and $7 wine, Thursday Burger + Pint combo & Nine‑Pin $5 cans, weekend brunch specials and trivia nightshttps://lostandfoundalbany.com/https://lostandfoundalbany.com/albany-warehouse-district-lost-and-found-bar-and-kitchen-happy-hours-specials

name: 677 Prime (Social Hour)
column6: ‘Social Hour’ starts at 4:30 PM every Mon–Thur (beginning Sep 3) with crafted cocktails, premium wines and gourmet bites; the bar’s happy‑hour period runs Mon–Thur 4:30 – 6 PMhttps://www.677prime.com/promotions/socialhour#:~:text=Social%20Hour%20at%20677%20Primehttps://www.677prime.com/promotions/socialhour#:~:text=

name: The City Beer Hall
column6: Historic beer hall with 20 rotating taps and full bar. During happy hour (Wed–Sat 4 PM – 6 PM according to Downtown Albany BID) patrons receive a **free personal pizza** with each beer or cocktail purchasehttps://www.downtownalbany.org/happy-hour-downtown-albany#:~:text=Pull%20up%20a%20seat%21%20Here%27s,restaurants%2C%20and%20eateries%20in%20Downtownhttps://www.downtownalbany.org/business/city-beer-hall#:~:text=,Albany%2C%20NY%2012207; features indoor/outdoor seating and frequent events

name: McGeary’s Irish Pub
column6: Neighborhood Irish pub known for sliders, shepherd’s pie and fish & chips. According to the Downtown Albany BID, McGeary’s offers a daily happy hour from 4 PM – 6 PMhttps://www.downtownalbany.org/happy-hour-downtown-albany#:~:text=McGeary%E2%80%99s%20Irish%20Pub%204%20Clinton,6%3A00%20PM; the pub posts daily specials on its Facebook pagehttps://www.downtownalbany.org/business/mcgearys-irish-pub#:~:text=Great%20food,that%20and%20more%20at%C2%A0McGeary%E2%80%99s%C2%A0in%20Downtown

name: Wellington’s Bar + Lounge
column6: Fine‑dining lounge inside the Renaissance Albany Hotel. The Downtown Albany BID notes that its “Bar Ritual” happy hour runs Sunday–Wednesday from 5 PM until a communal punch bowl runs dry (by ~6 PM), offering an evening cocktail ritual for guestshttps://www.downtownalbany.org/happy-hour-downtown-albany#:~:text=144%20State%20Street%20,6%3A00%20PM%20at%20the%20latest

name: Albany Ale & Oyster
column6: Happy Hour Mon–Fri 3–5 PM: $10 select cocktails, $10 natural wine pours, $6 select drafts, $2 raw oysters, $10 hot pretzel with mustards, $24 lobster roll with sea‑salt chips or salad (choice of warm brown butter or lobster salad), and a $25 “Happy Meal” featuring a smash burger with shoestring fries, three oysters and a can of Schaefer or glass of cava; Sunday special: $1 oysters all day
